Ingredients.1: 3  parsnips, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.2: 3  carrots, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.3: 1  celery root, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.5: 1  sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.6: 1 (2 pound) butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.15: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions.1: Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).

Directions.2: Combine parsnips, carrots, celery root, turnips, sweet potato, and butternut squash in a large roasting pan. Drizzle with olive oil, and season with 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. Toss vegetables to evenly distribute seasonings.

Directions.3: Roast in the preheated oven until the vegetables are easily pierced with a fork, 30 to 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes.

Directions.4: Meanwhile, melt the butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Stir in the celery and onion; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer, uncovered. Stir in the roasted vegetables and continue simmering for 10 minutes. Puree the soup using an immersion blender. Stir in the half and half, and season with salt and pepper, if necessary. If the soup becomes too thick, add more vegetable broth.
